metadata.title: CVE-2024-24859 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
A race condition was found in the Linux kernel's net/bluetooth insniff_{min,max}_interval_set() function. This can result in a bluetoothsniffing exception issue, possibly leading denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-24859` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-189-generic - 5.4.0-189.209~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-189-lowlatency - 5.4.0-189.209~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1133-azure - 5.4.0-1133.140~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1132-gcp - 5.4.0-1132.141~18.04.1
